top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Almanzo 100's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before May.
Almanzo 100's mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
65ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Almanzo 100, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Almanzo 100. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
6,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Almanzo 100, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 6,500ft of climbing on mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly does to your power file on race day.
6,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.heat: May in Spring Valley, Minnesota can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Almanzo 100. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Almanzo 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Almanzo 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of mixed gravel — well-maintained early, freshly laid loose stone mid-race in Spring Valley, Minnesota.
